alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 9:36AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: A developing tropical system, known as Invest 93W from the Joint Typhoon Warning Center, is currently located west of Saipan, around 16N and 143E. This system continues to slowly get more organized. A southwesterly monsoon flow is strengthening, with the strongest winds located just south of Guam. As 93W consolidates, it will drift slowly eastward today, then northwestward later, allowing the monsoon flow to lift northward to encompass all of the Marianas, with sustained southwesterly winds increasing. Timing: Through Wednesday evening Location: All of the Mariana Islands Rainfall: 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts possible Land: Sustained winds of 15 to 25 mph, with gusts to 35 mph will continue through Tuesday night, especially near heavier showers and thunderstorm that develop. Marine: Sustained winds of 15 to 25 knots with gusts to 35 knots will continue through Tuesday night. Seas of 7 to 10 feet for the Guam and Rota coastal waters will spread north into Tinian`s and Saipan`s coastal waters by this afternoon. Seas will then peak Tuesday into Wednesday in the 10 to 14 foot range, highest in the western coastal waters. Surf of 9 to 11 feet today will continue along south and west facing reefs, possibly reaching a peak of 13 feet Tuesday or Wednesday. Impacts: Periods of urban or flash flooding possible. Minor coastal beach erosion is also possible. Hazardous marine conditions will continue.
